info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 5:58AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...An intense lake effect snow band will affect northern Portage... northwestern Trumbull...Geauga...Cuyahoga...northeastern Summit... northeastern Lorain and southwestern Ashtabula Counties Until 700 AM EST.... At 557 AM EST, radar indicated an intense lake effect snow band along a line extending from Westlake to Middlefield, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARDS INCLUDE... Visibility rapidly dropping to less than a quarter of a mile... Snow rates in excess of one inch per hour... Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Lorain, Chardon, Parma, Lakewood, Euclid, Cleveland Heights, Westlake, North Ridgeville, Solon, Avon Lake, Twinsburg, Warrensville Heights, Macedonia, South Russell, Middlefield, Garrettsville, North Bloomfield, Orwell, and Burton. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this snow band passes your location. && ODOT DMS 302, 303, 304, 306, 307, 308, 309, 310, 311, 317, 318, 319, 320, 321, 322, 323, 324, 328, and 329.
